GameEvent.Name: First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
This system contains ruins from the pre-Cataclysm era. There are fragments of writing in multiple languages, and while very little remains sufficiently intact to be read, we have gleaned the words "Ancient Guardian."
We have heard rumors -- whispers and fragments from half-forgotten myths. If any of these stories contain even an element of truth, these ruins could be worth investigating.

GameEvent.Name: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
The artificial intelligence in our home system described to us the Vaults of the Ancient Guardians. It seems we have discovered one.
Who can understand the complexities of a machine mind? The Ancient Guardians preserved knowledge from across the galaxy, presumably for biological beings to use, and yet they make these Vaults a challenge to enter.
Perhaps they wish to test us with their puzzles? There are no puzzles the Quameno cannot master. Our greatest minds will have to begin researching the secrets of these vaults. Only then will we know how to proceed.

Our scientists have completed their research on Ancient Guardian Vault Investigations.
There are now two possible ways forward, only one of which will provide the information we need to open the vault. We cannot know which is the right one and will have to take our chances.

Our research has revealed some astonishing discoveries. The Ancient Guardians were more than a myth. However unbelievable, they were real.
The Ancient Guardians were artificial beings, sentient mechanisms dedicated to preserving knowledge in the event of a galaxy-wide disaster. In order to safeguard galactic civilization against a collapse, they established "Vaults" throughout the galaxy, repositories for knowledge that could help a fallen galaxy rebuild.
The Ancient Guardians believed that knowledge was precious, but also dangerous, and so Vaults are not easily accessed. Those who discover a Vault must prove their worthiness by conducting preliminary research in order to open it.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
The exterior of the Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} is covered with symbols and markings. They may be letters or pictograms or something completely unrelated to these concepts. As our explorers approach, they hear a voice: "What does governance mean for your society or for other societies? What principles transcend the limits of culture and species? To comprehend the most advanced wisdom, it is first necessary to have a foundation. Do you have this foundation? I await your reply?"
Is this voice part of an automated system? Does the Vault itself possess an intelligence? There is no way to know. It is likely that the markings upon the exterior of the Vault present certain questions and may hint at the answers. One of our scientists has speculated that they are prompts that begin certain principles or axioms that we must then finish. In order to gain access to the Vault, we will have to decipher these markings and gain some sort of understanding of how the Ancient Guardians understood the concept of governance.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Civics was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Political Economy if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Political Economy was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Civics if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description: The Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} remains an enigma. As we approach, we receive some sort of telepathic communication, presented not in words but in ideas and feelings. These sensations can best be translated as "Explain to us your beliefs and procedures." What beliefs and procedures must we explain? And how? We suspect the answers can be presented telepathically, just like the questions, but where to find the answers? We must keep investigating.

The team on {0} examining the Ancient Guardian Vault has contacted us with some alarming news. One of our explorers has vanished. There is no sign of a struggle or accident. The explorer was there one moment and gone the next. We must consider evacuating all personnel until we can determine what dangers the rest of the team might face.

The situation on {0} has changed. Our scientist has returned, though "been returned" may be more accurate. It appears he was somehow abducted by the Ancient Guardians or some sort of mechanism within the Vault itself. He has no memory of his experiences, and he is unharmed except a… procedure has been performed upon him. There is no other way to say it. He has been returned to us pregnant.
A mysterious embryonic life grows within him. Initially we thought it was some sort of intelligence, but a thorough examination reveals something far more complicated. The lifeform is not any sort of sentient being, but rather a living data repository, perhaps an Ancient Guardian system of recording and transmitting knowledge. Our doctors have been able to remove and sustain this living "data," but now we must determine its purpose.
Our best guess is that the data contains information on how the artificial Ancient Guardians understood both the ethics and practices of biological medicine. If we can decode the information encoded in genetic data of this living tissue, perhaps we will be able to telepathically provide the information the Ancient Guardians require.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Medical Ethics was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Medical Praxis if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Medical Praxis was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Medical Ethics if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

Investigate Kiraditu's Principles of Colonial Defense Vault (Quameno)

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Kiraditu's Principles of Colonial Defense Vault 2 (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
Our team of explorers have contacted us from {0} with alarming news. They tells us they have been transported somewhere, very likely the interior of the Ancient Guardian Vault they were investigating. Within they have found a massive battleground rendered in holograms. The combatants are represented by 6 different colored cylinders, perhaps meant to signify any species or no species at all. At regular intervals, the cylinders engage in combat - direct battles, sieges, counterattacks, ambushes, and so forth. Various members of our team have been prompted to lead either side of these campaigns, thus far unsuccessfully.
Our explorers say they have sufficient food and water to last them months or even years. This suggests that they will not be permitted to leave until they understand how to lead the cylinder armies to victory. Doing so, we suspect, will unlock the Ancient Guardian Vault, allowing our explorers to leave and allowing us to enter and examine the contents.
Fortunately, our explorers are able to record these hologram battles and send us the recordings. By analyzing them, we believe we can not only learn how to win these battles, but also understand the alien and unfamiliar strategies victory will require. We will need more time to fully understand how these Ancient Guardians approached matters of tactical and strategic warfare.

GameEventAction.Description: Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Tactics was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Strategy if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
The Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} has an open doorway and appears easily accessible, but it is guarded by several dozen perpetually-moving metallic spheres. When approached, the spheres telepathically deliver a message that is more impressionistic than linguistic, but most of our explorers translate it as Lead us! This act of leadership appears to be mandatory. When an explorer approaches the entrance of the Vault, one of the spheres will fire an energy weapon at them. The initial blasts were very low power, mildly painful warnings, but with each attempt, the blasts become more powerful. Any further escalation will no doubt render them deadly.
What does it mean to "lead" these spheres? We believe the answer may lie in the motion of the spheres. These movements may contain symbols which convey information. Deciphering this information will likely provide the necessary information for "leading" the spheres. This is clearly a test, and an extremely complicated one. It may take some time to puzzle out what the Ancient Guardians want from us.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Leadership Theory was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Leadership Observations if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Leadership Observations was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Leadership Theory if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
Moments ago our team of explorers investigating the Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} vanished. We are now receiving a transmission that appears to be coming from within the Vault itself.
"Biological entities, perhaps you have encountered other Ancient Guardians in your travels. Perhaps not. Regardless it is important for you to understand that we do not function as a unified whole. There are among us factions that view biological intelligence differently. We represent a faction whose name you could not comprehend. What is important is that you understand we are far more skeptical of the value of biological life than many of our kind. We doubt your worth as a whole, and we see little purpose in your existence as individuals.
"We tell you this so you will understand your explorers will die if you cannot demonstrate your worth. Your explorers have been placed on a ship far out of your reach, and they will never return unless you can answer in depth a series of questions about the engine schematics we will now send to you. If you are able to save your people, then you explain will be granted access to the Vault. This is an intentionally cruel test, and the lives of your explorers depend upon your ability to pass it."
We will have to begin examining these schematics to see what we can understand about Ancient Guardian mechanical and hyperdrive theory.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Mechanical Theory was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Hyperdrive Theory if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Hyperdrive Theory was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Mechanical Theory if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
The Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} is primarily subterranean. The entrance is open and accessible, and seems to stretch on endlessly into a labyrinthine structure. We have sent several mapping drones into the labyrinth, but they have not been able to find their way out. The most likely explanation is that the structure is a dynamic maze, constantly shifting. But is it shifting in some sort of pattern that can be deciphered.
We believe this is the case. The entrance to the labyrinth is marked with numerous symbols that seem to depict various modes of energy production, used in our culture as well as that used by aliens. Some of these are entirely unfamiliar to us.
Our plan is to use these symbols as a starting point. If we can understand what the Ancient Guardians are trying to tell us about energy and its production, we believe it will provide some sort of framework for understanding the maze itself. If we can accomplish that, then we believe we will be able to navigate the main and locked the sections of this Vault.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Energy Sources was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Energy Technology if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Energy Technology was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Energy Sources if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

Investigate Diplomacy and Other Means Vault 2 (Vaults)
Investigate Diplomacy and Other Means Vault (Quameno)

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Diplomacy and Other Means Vault 2 (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
We are receiving a transmission from our exploration team investigating an Ancient Guardian Vault on {0}. They have encountered a holographic projection of a distinguished figure of our own species, who identifies itself - through telepathic communication, not spoken words - as "The Diplomat."
This Diplomat has presented another hologram, a shifting puzzle composed of enigmatic symbols and interlocking patterns. The exploration team has received no explicit explanation, but each claims to somehow "know" that the various symbols represent specific aspects of concepts associated with diplomacy, such as negotiation, compromise, and strategic thinking.
By force of will, the different pieces can be moved and rearranged, creating larger, more complex, often dynamic, pieces. These larger pieces seem to represent more sophisticated diplomatic concepts. Once all of the pieces have been placed correctly, we believe the Vault will open.
The correct placement is surely linked to the Ancient Guardians' understanding of properly-conducted diplomacy. Therefore it is possible that by studying the symbols, and by seeing how smaller pieces can correctly be combined to create larger ones, we can begin to learn the necessary concepts that will unlock the Vault.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Diplomacy and Other Means Correct Research (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description: Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Diplomatic History was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Diplomatic Theory if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
Our team exploring the Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} has encountered a vast array of intricately carved stone statues, each the size of an adult of our species and weighing twice as much. The statues come in perhaps two dozen different shapes, though there are multiple instances of each of these, some far more numerous than others.
Having reviewed these various shapes against all known cultural databases, we have concluded that the statues are oversized game pieces from an unknown strategic game played before the Cataclysm. While this is largely a hypothesis, our analytical models tell us there is a high degree of likelihood the game centered around a theme of planetary siege warfare.
Based on these suppositions, we speculate that there is not one, but several related and interlinked games simultaneously being played out on the planet surface. Using drones equipped with anti-grav technology, the pieces can be moved and, when we do so, pieces of the opposing side move in turn. Several experiments have led us to believe that we are responsible for moving the defending pieces and some unknown force is moving the attackers.
Based on all of this data, it appears likely that in order to gain entry to the Ancient Guardian Vault, we must win all of the interlinked defending games. Doing so will require an understanding of Ancient Guardian defensive principles that we believe can be revealed by analyzing the original placement to the game pieces and also by studying the response to moves we make.
This will be a slow and painstaking process, but we can see no other means of gaining entry to the Vault.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Defensive Tactics was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Defensive Structures if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.

Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Defensive Structures was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Defensive Tactics if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
Our exploration team on {0} reports that the Ancient Guardian Vault is surrounded by a field of strange, asymmetrical crystalline structures. The air around them resonates with a faint energy that can be felt but not detected by our sensors. Touching the crystalline structure produces a strange noise that our explorers at first believed was an entirely unknown language, but they now suspect is a form of music based on principles entirely unknown to us. Each of these "musical notes" is accompanied by a telepathic sensation which causes the explorer to think of a specific engineering or propulsion concept, such as a design principle or a piece of hardware. The range seems varied, though each note seems consistently linked with the same telepathic property.
It is likely that in order to gain access to the Vault, we must first use these crystalline structures to perform a musical composition that speaks to, as of this moment, unknown Ancient Guardian engineering principles. We can only learn more by experimenting and seeing what telepathic concepts are invoked by interacting with the structures and then analyzing those structures within what we are able to glean about Ancient Guardian engineering principles.
We have much research to do before we can access the Vault.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Propulsion was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Engineering if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Engineering was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Propulsion if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Vault Encountered by Quameno Player (Vaults)
First Vault Encountered by Non-Quameno Player (Vaults)

GameEventAction.Description:
The Ancient Guardian Vault on {0} contains an entrance that leads to large antechamber. This has the feeling of a museum, as it is filled with hundreds of replicas of Ancient Guardian ships. Some are basic freighters or exploration vessels, others massive battleships and carriers. The aesthetics and design choices seem widely varied, often between different ships that serve the same function. There are, for example, nine different short-distance transport vessels, none of which resemble the others.
The various ships do not appear to be based on the designs of other species. Rather, it appears as if each ship is an experiment of an individual creator or team of creators attempting to rethink how a ship is supposed to function. Were the ships not psychically "labeled," no one would believe they all, or even any two, emerged from the same culture.
At the far end of the antechamber is a panel that, when touched, prompts a telepathic question: "What are the core principles of Ancient Guardian ship design?" We believe we are being prompted to study the design techniques of the Ancient Guardians, to understand the principles, engineering, and perhaps even aesthetic choices that govern their many types of ships. This is particularly challenging because of the mindboggling variety to be found. Nevertheless, there must be principles that unites these designs. Once we understand these, we believe we can provide a telepathic answer to their question and open the Vault.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Ship Design was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Engine Design if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
Unfortunately, researching Ancient Guardian Engine Design was not sufficient to open the Vault. We will have to research Ancient Guardian Ship Design if we hope to discover the Vault's secrets.
We have successfully completed the correct research and opened the Vault. Now we must venture inward.
Inside the Ancient Guardian Vault we've found information that will advance our research as well as an artifact that we have transfered to our home colony.
